item.title: Dune - Waters by Matt Rhodes
item.description:
"Tell me about the waters of your homeworld, Usul."
Another moment from Dune, using old character designs.

Paul's face is disrupted by the ripples, his vision of himself and his own future is disturbed.
He's standing in front of a vision of his future self (sideways skull), the worst possible future beginning to haunt him.

https://www.artstation.com/artwork/bgG1n
item.content:encoded:
"Tell me about the waters of your homeworld, Usul."

final


I struggle to do 1-1 fan art. I find it a lot more fun to play around with re-designs. In this case, i thought it'd be fun to get more literal. Half sailor costume, half astronaut.

item.title: The End - Tellurion 331 by Matt Rhodes
item.description: The end. I don’t know what to say. Thank you all so much for following along.  This was a passion project, something I’ve dreamed of doing for over half my life. Having everyone along for the ride, commenting, asking questions (I can’t answer), posting theories (that I can neither confirm nor deny), or just following along silently.  Thanks to my wife, Kate. Without her support this wouldn’t exist. She pushed for me to get a computer and tablet at home, she made room in the schedule for me to chip away at this project. For over 3 years she cheered me on.  There are more people to thank, but I’ll spread that out.  Next steps: I’m going to take a break. After 3 years and 3 months of creation, I’m going to take a little sabbath rest. No drawing for a month. I’m also going to be investigating my publishing options more intentionally. I’ll keep everyone posted about that as I go.  Again, from the bottom of my heart, thank you all.
item.content:encoded:
The end. I don’t know what to say. Thank you all so much for following along.  This was a passion project, something I’ve dreamed of doing for over half my life. Having everyone along for the ride, commenting, asking questions (I can’t answer), posting theories (that I can neither confirm nor deny), or just following along silently.  Thanks to my wife, Kate. Without her support this wouldn’t exist. She pushed for me to get a computer and tablet at home, she made room in the schedule for me to chip away at this project. For over 3 years she cheered me on.  There are more people to thank, but I’ll spread that out.  Next steps: I’m going to take a break. After 3 years and 3 months of creation, I’m going to take a little sabbath rest. No drawing for a month. I’m also going to be investigating my publishing options more intentionally. I’ll keep everyone posted about that as I go.  Again, from the bottom of my heart, thank you all.

item.title: Tellurion Soundtrack by Matt Rhodes
item.content:encoded:
In celebration of passing 300 images, and 70k followers on instagram, I wanted to do something special. 

Music has been an instrumental (haha) part of  creating Tellurion. I would think of the next big sequence in the story then sit back, put on my Tellurion playlist and watch it unfold. From there it was a simple matter of quickly scribbling out thumbnails to capture what I just watched. 

I've posted my playlist, so everyone is welcome to have a listen: Tellurion Playlist

Here are some of the sequences from Tellurion, paired up with the music that inspired them. 

Tellurion 053 - 059: John Dreamer - Becoming A Legend

Tellurion 060 - 079: Children of Dune OST - Summon the Worms

Tellurion 081 - 084: Treasure Planet OST: Silver Comforts Jim

Tellurion 097 - 101: Enya - Storms In Africa

Tellurion 111 - 113: Jesse Cook - Olodum

Tellurion 115 - 123: Atlantis Soundtrack - The Secret Swim

Tellurion 124 - 133: Planet Earth 2 OST - Early Morning Fog

Tellurion 139 - 147:  Immediate Music - Serenata Immortale

Tellurion 148 - 161: Children of Dune OST - The Golden Path

Tellurion 183 - 194: Audiomachine - Secrets and Treasures

Tellurion 195 - 210: Sinbad OST: Syracuse

Tellurion 216 - 241: Audiomachine - No Retreat, No Surrender

Tellurion 260 - 276: Time Machine OST - I Don't Belong Here

Tellurion 277 - 301: Stardust OST - Shooting Star
